Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodation - with a cheap price! I was very happy.”
Reviews.Author: PhilUSA2010
Reviews.Content: This is a University dorm converted into summer accommodation for guests. But for $50 I got clean accommodation, shared bathroom, free parking and free breakfast included in that price. Inside the room is spartan e.g. no TV, hard floors etc, but for two nights it was fine. I had a little trouble bringing my bags up the steps to the lobby, but other than that I had no problems. Train station was a 2-3 minute walk into central Montreal. If people want to complain about the accommodation, then open your wallet, find somewhere else and be prepared to pay a lot more. The service was also great at the desk and they spoke English and French fluently. A very convenient stay for 2 nights in Montreal and was easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “This is not frikking hotel, its university dorms!!! And dNt be fooled by the photos, expect more like an old fire station type b”
Reviews.Author: Theworldandus
Reviews.Content: To sum it up In two words I would describe this place as "false advertisement" for a start the pictures are completely different to what you actually get! It is NOT a hotel!!! It is university dorms (which by the way being a student myself I would not have paid to stay in these dorms) they advertise a pool??? There is a local leisure centre half a mile up the road which you pay to use?? I'm surprised they didn't advertise a cinema and restaurant too because they also have those in the city centre? A private double room, gives you.. A room, with one small bed I would say more like a large single, with plastic thin camping matteress, oh and you have just enough room to scoot around the bed (bearing in mind I am a petite girl) oh and a strange computer desk an a fridge! The "kitchen ficilitys" are cookers and microwaves... Don't expect even one piece of cutlery or any kind of cookware/utensils (so you can't actually cook anything here) the receptionist wanted me to leave my passport with him to borrow the one very questionable pot they dis have in reception... I declined! The breakfast is hilarious! A dry muffin and maybe a yogurt! Oh and there is no wifi (even though people stated there was some in reception we never found this) they offered us cable????? What is this noahs ark! It's the 20th century, and this is university dorms? Anyway we didn't want to pay anymore money for that either. To top it both lifts were broken throughout the week we were there and were very unreliable/dangerous if you did even get a chance to try them (I nearly had my head cut open when one of them was reapeatingly opening and closing when I was trying to get out) oh and did I mention is 15 floors high... Enjoy the hike if your nuts enough to stay here, I wouldn't even waste $10 a night if it got that cheap it puts some dingy hostels to shame!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning and very basic”
Reviews.Author: Jingle345
Reviews.Content: Negative things: I stayed here during July, when the temperatures were reaching above 30 in the middle of the day. My room was uncomfortably hot most of the time, even during the night when the temperature dropped the room stayed hot if the wind wasn't blowing in the right direction. The shared bathrooms were clean, but also extremely hot with no ventilation. Positive things: The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the location is good - 5 minute walk to the Metro and 10 minute walk from the Cote de Nege where the night bus drops you off. A taxi from the city centre to the Hotel cost me around 13 CAD. The University area is also very nice and safe, I was walking around at 4 am and even asked someone for directions with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Its average at best. Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: tingtong1234
Reviews.Content: This is a university dorm converted to a hotel. The rooms are NOT spacious at all. Completely stuffy with only a small window. They do provide a fan, though. The staff, however, is very courteous and helpful. The room I had reserved didn't have an attached toilet/bath. There was a shared one for the entire floor (about 10-12 rooms, making it 1 between probably 20 people). Luckily, it was not crowded on my floor and using the bathroom didn't cause as much problems, as I had anticipated. They do not provide free breakfast and we need to pay $7 everyday. The breakfast options are not that great either (coffee, bagels, muffins, corn flakes and croissants). The hotel lobby has free wi-fi and hence you need not get 'wired' internet in your room by shelling extra 5 bucks per day. They also charge $12 per day for parking. The location of the hotel is not good and any good restaurant is at least a 20 min walk away. It is however, very close to the METRO station and using the METRO you could move around anywhere ($3 ticket for METRO one way). Overall, I was not happy paying $55 + taxes for one night for this hotel. Its certainly not worth $55.

Reviews.Title: “A University Residence - a little out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: localguy101
Reviews.Content: If you need to be in Montreal - and don't have a lot of money to spend then consider this place. It is 30m by two subways and a short walk from Downtown, and the closest subway line stops at midnight. They may put you in one of at least two buildings - one of which on the side of Mont Royal - so there are stairs involved (get them to tell you about the elevator route - to save some stairs). There is very little in the way of restaurants in the immediate area - but a walk or Bixi ride will take you to Cote de Niege which has a nice selection. On the plus - the place is clean, seems safe. They seem pretty organized. There is paid access to breakfast, internet and the sports complext. There are no signs for this place - so make note that the Reception desk is at Pavillon ThÃ©rÃ¨se-Casgrain - which is the tall triangle tower. It would be great if they could have it shown on the map at the closest Subway/Metro station. Try to get a room in that building as it avoid stairs - and perhaps it is where the pretty pictures on thier website were taken (other rooms are far more bland). And if you can - bring a favourite pillow - the one provided is not great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views, great service, bad location.”
Reviews.Author: JeremyA
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference this weekend and stayed at Les Studios Hotel, which is what the UniversitÃ© de MontrÃ©al calls their student residences during the summer when they rent them out as cheap hotel rooms. I live in a suburb of Montreal, but figured since it was included with the conference I'd take advantage and stay downtown for the weekend. The size of the room is pretty typical of a university resident. There's enough space to move around, but nothing extra. No Television. Wired (not wi-fi) Internet is available at a cost of $5/night, which is a little different from the norm of most hotels these days that have free wifi. As far as I can gather, all rooms permit smoking, since there was no "non-smoking" option at checkin and my room had an ashtray. I couldn't detect much of a smoky smell though, which is good since I don't smoke. The best thing about the hotel is their service. I would have expected some surly night guard to take care of check-ins at a place like this, but they have a fancy front desk area with very friendly staff. This may be cheap, but the staff talk to you like it's a 5-star hotel. Try to get a room on as high a floor as possible. I was in room 16111, and the views of downtown Montreal were amazing, especially at night. The windows open very wide, which is nice for getting a better view and letting in air. The beds are not very comfortable, especially the pillows...they seem to be all wrapped in a thick layer of plastic. I would suggest you bring your own pillow, and even foam matt if possible. The location is not ideal. It is located between two metro stations (Ã‰douard-Montpetit and UniversitÃ©-de-MontrÃ©al). Being on the blue line, service is pretty infrequent, especially later in the evening. You have to transfer at Jean-Talon or Snowdon coming from downtown, where you might end up waiting over 10 minutes. Luckily there's a BIXI (public bicycle sharing) stand right in front which is handy for cruising down rue CÃ´te-Sainte-Catherine into the city, but you probably wouldn't want to bike back up the hill, so use of the metro is pretty much inevitable. In conclusion, Les Studios provides great views and clean, modern-looking rooms at a reasonable cost and with great service, but you aren't right downtown, so it's best only if you're attending something north of Mount Royal, or if you plan to bike over to the Plateau Mont-Royal. If I was paying my own way, I'd probably have picked one of the downtown hostels...they might not be quite as clean, and the service might not be as good, but at least you'd be right downtown in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better!”
Reviews.Author: ashokatomik
Reviews.Content: Room adequate for 1 person. Not as good as photos would suggest. Shared toilet and shower. Adequate but only because there were not many people staying there. Separate toilets for men and women by the way. Biggest problem from my point of view was the lack of tableware and cutlery to use in the room. Even on request none available! No coffee making facilities either (which coming from Europe is quite a change). But there was a refrigerator to use. Did not make sense.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible -Terrible-don't stay here....”
Reviews.Author: Traveler26155019
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here..never.. worse hotel.. live in downtown 5 star hotel instead..downtown is more live..this hotel no A/C..expensive..3rd class.. we didn't get room till 5pm eventhough they should be giving at 3pm... other good family people were also been fooled by their photos and website ...Those idiots charge $12 for parking too..

Reviews.Title: “Basically a dorm room”
Reviews.Author: vanorder
Reviews.Content: A word to the wise - this place is ok, sort of, but the web site makes it look a lot nicer than it is. Basically, it's a dorm. The service is pretty good, but the rooms are not welcoming. They are fine for sleeping, but the beds are hard, short, and the pillows strangely shaped, so I ended up sleeping on a rolled up towel. Otherwise, the painted concrete building kind of sucks. The other issue is that, given that this room is ok for sleeping but that's it, then people should be aware of the location. The nearest major street is 10-15 mins walk away, so you are pretty isolated. And the metro, while good, is 4-5 mins away, and requires a transfer to go downtown, so the other person's estimate of 20 mins downtown is very optimistic. It usually took me a full half hour. Overall, this place would be a decent hostelly option to me, as long as they presented themselves as such. I was very surprised by what I was getting having seen the website, and while I was there another (older) couple had a meltdown when they realized that they had reserved a university dorm room, when they thought it was a smallish hotel room, which the website really suggests. If the whole place was as nice as the parts they renovated prior to the web site photo shoot, then it would be a whole other story.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend to anyone, ever”
Reviews.Author: raccoonalist
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during the hottest season in July with temperatures up to 35 C. We knew the rooms weren't air conditioned, but we never imagined how unconfortable it would be. The mattress and pillows were covered with plastic which made sleeping in the heat almost impossible. The bed was also very hard. Apparently the room hadn't been vacuumed at all, as the floor was dirty. The hotel had a laundry room as advertised, but instead of being coin-operated the washers and dryers need a special card. You can get a card from the reception, but what they fail to mention is that you have to deposit money on the card yourself. This would not be a problem were it possible to charge the card with an amount of your own choosing, but the minimum amount is 10 dollars. One wash cost 1.50. Thus we paid 15 dollars for one wash as you cannot purchase detergent at the hotel (the cheapest pack we found was 5 dollars).

Reviews.Title: “Simple, but cheap”
Reviews.Author: DavidB2010
Reviews.Content: You are basically staying in a student room with a bathroom. So, it is not luxuriuous, and don't expect it to be cleaned every day (actually once a week). It is also not in the city centre. On the other hand it was clean and cheap, and the staff, as other writers have noted, were very helpful. It is an excellent location for the university, and actually quite a nice area. There are also two metro stations just a few minutes walk away. If you are on a budget, or have business at the university, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared for a dorm room”
Reviews.Author: trappedinhell
Reviews.Content: Unless you have business at the UniversitÃ© de MontrÃ©al (which I did), it is not worth staying at this "hotel". Granted I was there during a heat waves (40+ degrees Celsius) so that did not help matters but staying at Les Studios is really only one marginal step up from a hostel. I did not get more than 3 hours of sleep per night as the poor air circulation and lack of air conditioning left me drenched in sweat even when I was just lying unmoving on the bed. The worst part, though, is the shared shower and toilet (yes, singular) per floor. The bathroom is not configured for privacy so outside of the shower curtain, when you are done showering, you could potentially be standing naked while someone else walks in - think single room bathroom without the benefit of a lock on the door. The only saving grace is that the bathroom is not co-ed (though the floors are).

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: AntigenBand
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've been here for reasons related to visiting the university of Montreal. Buyer beware: This is not what the average person would consider a 3 or 4 star hotel (it may be 4 stars with respect to onsite amenities but not in terms of room comfort etc). It's basically a university dormitory with shared bathrooms, horrible air circulation, and the most uncomfortable bed I've ever slept on. Let me elaborate. Bed: The worst aspect of this place is the bed. The mattress *and* pillow are both covered with a hard plastic material under the sheets (I guess to protect against soiling) which are extremely uncomfortable... Like you have to experience this to believe it. i can't believe they think this is acceptable for anybody, and I'm not one who expects posh things out of life. Ive had trouble sleeping all week because of it, and as a result have missed lectures that I was supposed to attend due to sleepiness. Air Circulation: There is none. The room has a large window which you can open, but Im writing this review sitting 1 foot away from it and I cannot feel the slightest hint of a breeze, it must be constantly 27C in the room and its like 20C outside. This room is horribly designed. Other issues: The staff are superfriendly. The location is very convenient if you want to go to campus. And the rooms have a sink and fridge, which is a plus. Normally I would give this place 2 out of 5, but Im really annoyed with how they advertise themselves as a 4 star hotel, so Im bumping it down to a 1 star. They clean your room once a week. They have foosball tables, pool tables, chess etc in the lobby. If you're paying hostel prices for this place, maybe you'll be ok with it, but really think about what I've said! Oh btw, and the single room bed is tiny in height, keep in mind if you're tall.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but not worth it”
Reviews.Author: blanketygoodness
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Les Studios Hotel because I was attending a meeting at the University of Montreal and there are really no other hotels in the area. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and the price was good, but those are about the only positive things I can say about this place. They did not have any rooms with private bathrooms available, so I had to use a shared bathroom. There were only two showers and one toilet for the entire floor, and these were housed in a very small and cramped washroom. Luckily I managed to avoid other guests in my short stay, but if two people use the bathroom at the same time one would have zero privacy! My room was small and looked clean, but I was allergic to something in it (dust? mould?). The bed was the worst part. I like a firm mattress, but both the bed and pillow were way too hard to sleep on comfortably. They also used some sort of plastic under-sheet that was awkward and uncomfortable. I slept so poorly that I was dosing off during my meetings. A very basic breakfast was offered at a charge (also not worth it, but no other options for breakfast in the area). Stay here if you have some business at the University of Montreal, but if you don't mind commuting, have the budget for something more, and need a good night's sleep, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: avialevin
Reviews.Content: I booked with this hotel but once I arrived they didn't have rooms so they sent me to the "University de Montreal residence", a 100 meters walk and a small climb... I originally booked and "all included"- breakfast and internet but since I wanted the internet for my phone and there is no wifi in the "residence" they changed it without a problem so it was ~40$ a night. It is an old building, no air conditioner, small rooms and shared bathroom. The room was clean and had sheets, towels, soap, sink and a minifridge as well as a closet. The bathroom was also clean. There is a metro station 4 minutes walking distance ("Edouard Monpetit"), it has the blue line. I payed for the parking but if I understood from the signs in the street, you can park there in the summer so you can save a few bucks. If you plan on sitting in your room a lot- this is NOT the place for you. It's not a very welcoming room so it will be great if you plan to travel and only come to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but good location, nice staff, clean, very affordable”
Reviews.Author: Sonyo_of_Maine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basically a dorm that you are staying in, with shared bathrooms and small, simple rooms. It's like a very safe hostel in what feels like a relatively safe part of the city. Pros: It has everything that you need (a clean place to sleep, wired internet, bath, and breakfast), and is very very affordable. It's fun talking to other people - often international travelers - at breakfast, which is a simple croissant-bagel-cereal-juice-coffee-fruit affair. The Metro and a grocery are just a few blocks away, and you can see St. Joseph's oratory from the windows of the tower. It only takes about 20 minutes on the Metro to get to favorite locations, like Old Montreal or the downtown Rue St. Catherine area. There is a refrigerator in your room, and I think a kitchenette on the first floor, so you can save even more $ on food. The staff were VERY friendly, helpful, and very good at English. Cons: The bed isn't comfy (It's a hard bed, and I'd recommend bringing your own pillow if you're driving), and you have to leave your room to use the shared bath. Basic dorm fare. Parking is on the street, or a few limited spaces. In the summer on the weekend, I was able to get away with not paying for a permit, but otherwise it would only cost $12/day, which is not bad. I'd definitely recommend this to any frugal traveler.
